nodes.bodyText: By using a return statement here the check may miss flagging the value if it is also bad, and flagging other tags if an object has multiple bad conditional tags. Thus it could take multiple cycles of running the check and editing the feature to fully fix the problems. It would probably be better to add the instruction to a list of generated instructions for this feature, and flag the feature later if that list is not empty. You can see an example of this sort of arrangement in RoundaboutValenceCheck.
Please add this keyword when accessing the methods.

The CommonConstants class cab be leveraged here: 
  
    
      atlas-checks/src/main/java/org/openstreetmap/atlas/checks/constants/CommonConstants.java
    
    
         Line 28
      in
      d070ac4
    
    
    
    

        
          
           public static final String COLON = ":";
Any reason why these are set to access public?
This could be made static to avoid recompilation for each instance of the class.
I think this variable is not required. We can simply return true/false based on the condition. For example:  if (!trimmedPart.isEmpty() && !isAccessValue(trimmedPart)) { return false; }
